intro: Dyssodia ciliosa, commonly known as the silky dyssodia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, silvery-haired leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Dyssodia ciliosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
